properties.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 10 at 3:38PM EST until January 12 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Burlington VT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy freezing rain with significant icing expected.
Total ice accumulations of a half inch to one inch expected in
lower elevations, especially in and around the Chateaugay and
Burke areas. Ice accumulations will be significantly lower
further south near Saranac Lake and Tupper Lake.

* WHERE...Portions of Franklin County in New York.

* WHEN...Freezing rain is expected Saturday night into Sunday
morning, and will be moderate to heavy at times. Precipitation
will end as a brief period of snow Sunday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Expect power outages and tree damage due to the ice.
Travel could be very difficult Saturday night into Sunday owing
to icy roads.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty southwest winds 25 to 35 mph will
develop Sunday afternoon, which will could have an impact on
any ice laden trees and powerlines.
properties.instruction:
Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency. Prepare for possible power outages.

Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

NWSheadline: ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM SATURDAY TO 1 PM EST SUNDAY
